docs.lead_paragraph: HOMES OF AMERICAN AUTHORS; COMPRISING AN-ECLOTICAL. PERSONAL AND DESCRIPTIVE SKETCH ES, BY VARIOUS WRITERS. Illustrated with views of their residences from original drawings, and a facsimile of the manuscript of each author. G. P. PUTNAM Co., No. 10 Park-place. We greatly misjudge the public taste if this elegant volume stand not foremost among Holiday favorites.

headline.main: LATEST INTELLIGENCE; By Telegraph to the New-York Daily Times. XXXIId CONGRESS...Second Session. SENATE HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Senate was called to order at 25 minutes past 12 o'clock. A letter from Mr. KING, requesting Mr. ATCHISON to preside, was read, and no objection being made, Mr. A. took the Chair. Mr. NORBIS, of N.H., appeared to-day and took his seat. Mr. UNDERWOOD presented numerous petitions against the employment of Chaplains.

headline.main: HAVANA; Post Office Espionage--Release of Capt. Gray--Affairs in Cuba.

docs.lead_paragraph: I am happy to be able to state, that Capt. GRAY, his son, and the crew of the late Lady Suffolk, were released last evening from the " Carcel Tacon," the Captain remaining here under the personal security given by Mr. ANTONIO CABARGO, until the cause is closed, which would not have been accepted had there been any appearance of criminality attaching to the Captain or any of his officers or crew.
